title: Naka Vihara
text: Naka Vihara (<a href="Sinhalese%20language">Sinhala</a>ː නඛා වෙහෙර) is a <a href="Stupa">dagoba</a> belonging to the late Anuradhapura period between 7-10 centuries C.E. and located in <a href="Anuradhapura">Anuradhapura</a>, <a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>. The dagoba has been built with bricks and square in shape. The site was constructed according to an unusual model and would have been similar to the seven story building <a href="Satmahal%20Prasadaya">Satmahal Prasadaya</a> in <a href="Polonnaruwa">Polonnaruwa</a>, <a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>. Excavations done at this location revealed several clay caskets.
